title: U.S. shares lower at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.95%
text:
U.S. shares lower at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.95%

Investing.com – U.S. equities were lower at the close on Friday, as losses in the , and sectors propelled shares lower.

At the close in NYSE, the lost 0.95%, while the index lost 0.39%, and the index fell 0.83%.

The biggest gainers of the session on the were Coca-Cola Company (NYSE: ), which rose 1.84% or 0.99 points to trade at 54.78 at the close. Verizon Communications Inc (NYSE: ) added 1.06% or 0.64 points to end at 61.05 and Merck & Company Inc (NYSE: ) was up 1.05% or 0.88 points to 84.68 in late trade.

Biggest losers included Boeing Co (NYSE: ), which lost 6.79% or 25.06 points to trade at 344.00 in late trade. Johnson & Johnson (NYSE: ) declined 6.22% or 8.47 points to end at 127.70 and American Express Company (NYSE: ) shed 1.96% or 2.34 points to 116.76.

The top performers on the S&P 500 were Kansas City Southern (NYSE: ) which rose 7.26% to 145.25, Intuitive Surgical Inc (NASDAQ: ) which was up 6.96% to settle at 566.25 and State Street Corp (NYSE: ) which gained 6.10% to close at 63.34.

The worst performers were L Brands Inc (NYSE: ) which was down 9.89% to 16.31 in late trade, Boeing Co (NYSE: ) which lost 6.79% to settle at 344.00 and Johnson & Johnson (NYSE: ) which was down 6.22% to 127.70 at the close.

The top performers on the NASDAQ Composite were Greenland Acquisition Corp (NASDAQ: ) which rose 47.99% to 10.330, Bionano Genomics Inc (NASDAQ: ) which was up 37.68% to settle at 1.90 and Attis Industries Inc (NASDAQ: ) which gained 31.58% to close at 1.75.

The worst performers were BIOLASE Inc (NASDAQ: ) which was down 19.80% to 0.8020 in late trade, Synthesis Energy Systems Inc (NASDAQ: ) which lost 18.04% to settle at 7.5400 and Capstone Turbine Corp (NASDAQ: ) which was down 15.38% to 0.330 at the close.

Declining stocks outnumbered rising ones by 1435 to 1381 and 101 ended unchanged; on the Nasdaq Stock Exchange, 1543 fell and 1064 advanced, while 92 ended unchanged on the New York Stock Exchange.

The , which measures the implied volatility of S&P 500 options, was up 3.34% to 14.25.

In commodities trading, Gold Futures for December delivery was down 0.33% or 4.95 to $1493.35 a troy ounce. Meanwhile, Crude oil for delivery in November fell 0.39% or 0.21 to hit $53.72 a barrel, while the December Brent oil contract fell 1.03% or 0.62 to trade at $59.29 a barrel.

EUR/USD was up 0.44% to 1.1171, while USD/JPY fell 0.21% to 108.42.

The US Dollar Index Futures was down 0.42% at 96.925.
description: U.S. shares lower at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.95%
